intro: Hieracium glabricaule, commonly known as the smooth-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous yellow flowers in a composite head. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant is typically short-lived, with a lifespan of one to two years. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role in open habitats.
